carehome_co_uk.title: Barchester Westgate House Care Home, London

reviews.review_text: I was very concerned, when we were admitting our mother in Westgate House Care Home. Because we heard a lot of stories regarding mistreatment to resident in care homes. But my experience with WG Care Home completly changed my vision. I can not immagive we will have such a Excellent service over here. With the leadership of Sharon & Lavina all staff is doing great Job. All I can say now, "Keep up the good work"

The staff were very welcoming when mum first moved in. The room was clean, with plenty of storage space and ensuite. The nursing care has been excellent - the senior nurses were introduced to me and they have always been helpful and knowedgable. Regular doctor visits too have improved mum's care. The manager and deputy manager are very approachable and have always answered any questions I have.

I was so pleased with the care my Mother got, She was kept clean and comfortable. She also was very happy with all the staff. I would be happy to leave her there the next time i need respite My Mother came home very happy and said if I was ever to go away that's where she would like to stay. The Staff were very friendly and it made me feel good to know I could relax because she was in safe hands.

My dad has been a resident at Westgate House Care Home for over 1 year. He is very happy there. He has Vascular Dementia and needs help with his 'daily needs', such as washing & shaving, dressing etc. He has a lovely room with its own toilet and sink, so he can maintain his own continents. He loves the food (which smells lovely). And the staff are great company and are friendly towards him. My dad joins in daily activities which he enjoys and is taken out regularly so he gets fresh air and fun. Westgate House have a lovely garden, which is lovely for visitors to sit out with the resident. I have had a whole year of 'Peace of mind' knowing my dad is well cared for and in a safe place.
I came to the home straight from having a mastectomy. From arrival to leaving the service, across the whole home has been outstanding. All staff work tirelessly for the

My father has been in Westgate House Care Home for over a month and has settled in well. The staff have been so kind and caring, and I know he’s in safe hands. The meals always provide a choice and are of very high quality. My father thoroughly enjoys them and looks very well as a result. Our family was able to celebrate his recent birthday at the home. The staff decorated a room specially and also provided an amazing cake. I’m so grateful for the care he has received. All the staff have been unfailingly cheerful and welcoming whenever we visit.

My father resided at Westgate House Care Home for 10 months sadly passing away in December 2022. Throughout his time at the nursing home, he was treated with the utmost care and dignity. The staff took special care of the whole family's well-being during my dad's final weeks. As a family, we are very grateful to have found this nursing home.

My mum's been in Westgate for a month now, and the staff have been very friendly and extremely good - informing us of any concerns and what Mum likes, etc. They let us know when they feel concerned about anything, i.e. not taking meds or eating. One thing I do wish is they allow Mum to find her feet, I know she's unstable, and they have to assure her safety, but it's only since taken into the hospital she's been unsteady - she needs to build her muscles up again.

My nan has been in this home for almost two years and I cannot fault her care. She always seems happy and well kept when I see her. New Covid restrictions are over I can take my children into the home and staff are always very welcoming.
Very good caring and very clean and very friendly staff.
